description.narrative: The Australian Civilian Corps (ACC) is a whole of government initiative that deploys civilian specialists, primarily to help Australia's neighbours in the Indo-Pacific region to prevent, prepare for, stabilise and recover from disasters and conflict. Funding under this investment will provide for the deployment of an ACC Livelihoods Officer to United Nations High Commission for Refugees (UNHCR), based in the Hpa-An Office, Myanmar, for a period of 12 months. The Livelihoods Officer will provide technical assistance and lead the refinement and implementation of UNHCR's livelihoods strategy for south-east Myanmar. This will include oversight and support to the work of implementing partners, facilitating knowledge exchanges and coordination activities and develop the capacity of local partners on key themes, such as entrepreneurship training.
